intro: Spathacanthus, commonly known as the arrowhead plant, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Cyperaceae. These plants are characterized by their triangular or arrow-shaped leaves, which give them their common name. They typically grow in wet or marshy environments, thriving in moist soils. Spathacanthus species are often found in temperate regions and are sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes. The flowers are usually small and clustered, forming dense inflorescences that contribute to their ecological role in wetland ecosystems.
